Name: [The Emergency Shelter]
Description: Someone survived here. For a while. A reinforced safe room designed for facility disasters - and it worked. Emergency supplies remain, carefully rationed. A sleeping pallet in the corner. Data-slates filled with handwritten notes. Whoever lived here is gone now.
NarrativeText: The survivor's logs tell a story: trapped when The Great Silence fell, living on emergency rations for months, slowly losing hope. The final entry reads simply: 'Going outside. If I don't come back, at least I tried.' They never returned.
FlavorText: Shelves hold carefully organized supplies: water purifiers, medical kits, preserved food. A calendar on the wall tracks 287 days. Personal effects reveal a life lived in isolation: books, a chess set (both sides played), drawings of people they'd lost.
